intro: Gamochaeta, commonly known as blueweed, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and can be found in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and disturbed areas. They are characterized by their small, blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. Gamochaeta species often have opposite or whorled leaf arrangements, and their leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
